verses.verse: And it came to pass,<WH1961> that<WH3588> when Isaac<WH3327> was old,<WH2204> and his eyes<WH5869> were dim,<WH3543> so that he could not see,<WH4480> <WH7200> he called<WH7121> <WH853> Esau<WH6215> his eldest<WH1419> son,<WH1121> and said<WH559> unto<WH413> him, My son:<WH1121> and he said<WH559> unto<WH413> him, Behold,<WH2009> here am I.
And he said,<WH559> Behold<WH2009> now,<WH4994> I am old,<WH2204> I know<WH3045> not<WH3808> the day<WH3117> of my death: <WH4194>

Now <WH6258> therefore take,<WH5375> I pray thee,<WH4994> thy weapons,<WH3627> thy quiver<WH8522> and thy bow,<WH7198> and go out<WH3318> to the field,<WH7704> and take<WH6679> me some venison;<WH6718>

And make<WH6213> me savory meat,<WH4303> such as<WH834> I love,<WH157> and bring<WH935> it to me, that I may eat;<WH398> that<WH5668> my soul<WH5315> may bless<WH1288> thee before<WH2962> I die.<WH4191>

And Rebekah<WH7259> heard<WH8085> when Isaac<WH3327> spoke<WH1696> to<WH413> Esau<WH6215> his son.<WH1121> And Esau<WH6215> went<WH1980> to the field<WH7704> to hunt<WH6679> for venison,<WH6718> and to bring<WH935> it.

And Rebekah<WH7259> spoke<WH559> unto<WH413> Jacob<WH3290> her son,<WH1121> saying,<WH559> Behold,<WH2009> I heard<WH8085> <WH853> thy father<WH1> speak<WH1696> unto<WH413> Esau<WH6215> thy brother,<WH251> saying,<WH559>
Bring <WH935> me venison,<WH6718> and make<WH6213> me savory meat,<WH4303> that I may eat,<WH398> and bless<WH1288> thee before<WH6440> the LORD<WH3068> before<WH6440> my death.<WH4194>
Now <WH6258> therefore, my son,<WH1121> obey<WH8085> my voice<WH6963> according to that which<WH834> I<WH589> command<WH6680> thee.

Go <WH1980> now<WH4994> to<WH413> the flock,<WH6629> and fetch<WH3947> me from thence<WH4480> <WH8033> two<WH8147> good<WH2896> kids<WH1423> of the goats;<WH5795> and I will make<WH6213> them savory meat<WH4303> for thy father,<WH1> such as<WH834> he loveth: <WH157>
And thou shalt bring<WH935> it to thy father,<WH1> that he may eat,<WH398> and that<WH5668> <WH834> he may bless<WH1288> thee before<WH6440> his death.<WH4194>
And Jacob<WH3290> said<WH559> to<WH413> Rebekah<WH7259> his mother,<WH517> Behold,<WH2005> Esau<WH6215> my brother<WH251> is a hairy<WH8163> man,<WH376> and I<WH595> am a smooth<WH2509> man: <WH376>

My father<WH1> peradventure<WH194> will feel<WH4959> me, and I shall seem<WH1961> to him<WH5869> as a deceiver;<WH8591> and I shall bring<WH935> a curse<WH7045> upon<WH5921> me, and not<WH3808> a blessing.<WH1293>
And his mother<WH517> said<WH559> unto him, Upon<WH5921> me be thy curse,<WH7045> my son:<WH1121> only<WH389> obey<WH8085> my voice,<WH6963> and go<WH1980> fetch<WH3947> me them.
And he went,<WH1980> and fetched,<WH3947> and brought<WH935> them to his mother:<WH517> and his mother<WH517> made<WH6213> savory meat,<WH4303> such as<WH834> his father<WH1> loved.<WH157>

And Rebekah<WH7259> took<WH3947> <WH853> goodly<WH2530> raiment<WH899> of her eldest<WH1419> son<WH1121> Esau,<WH6215> which<WH834> were with<WH854> her in the house,<WH1004> and put them upon<WH3847> <WH853> Jacob<WH3290> her younger<WH6996> son: <WH1121>
And she put<WH3847> the skins<WH5785> of the kids<WH1423> of the goats<WH5795> upon<WH5921> his hands,<WH3027> and upon<WH5921> the smooth<WH2513> of his neck: <WH6677>
And she gave<WH5414> <WH853> the savory meat<WH4303> and the bread,<WH3899> which<WH834> she had prepared,<WH6213> into the hand<WH3027> of her son<WH1121> Jacob.<WH3290>
And he came<WH935> unto<WH413> his father,<WH1> and said,<WH559> My father:<WH1> and he said,<WH559> Here<WH2009> am I; who<WH4310> art thou,<WH859> my son?<WH1121>

And Jacob<WH3290> said<WH559> unto<WH413> his father,<WH1> I<WH595> am Esau<WH6215> thy firstborn;<WH1060> I have done<WH6213> according as<WH834> thou biddest<WH1696> <WH413> me: arise,<WH6965> I pray thee,<WH4994> sit<WH3427> and eat<WH398> of my venison,<WH4480> <WH6718> that<WH5668> thy soul<WH5315> may bless<WH1288> me.

And Isaac<WH3327> said<WH559> unto<WH413> his son,<WH1121> How<WH4100> is it<WH2088> that thou hast found<WH4672> it so quickly,<WH4116> my son?<WH1121> And he said,<WH559> Because<WH3588> the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> brought<WH7136> it to<WH6440> me.

And Isaac<WH3327> said<WH559> unto<WH413> Jacob,<WH3290> Come near,<WH5066> I pray thee,<WH4994> that I may feel<WH4184> thee, my son,<WH1121> whether thou<WH859> be my very<WH2088> son<WH1121> Esau<WH6215> or<WH518> not.<WH3808>

And Jacob<WH3290> went near<WH5066> unto<WH413> Isaac<WH3327> his father;<WH1> and he felt<WH4959> him, and said,<WH559> The voice<WH6963> is Jacob's<WH3290> voice,<WH6963> but the hands<WH3027> are the hands<WH3027> of Esau.<WH6215>
And he discerned<WH5234> him not,<WH3808> because<WH3588> his hands<WH3027> were<WH1961> hairy,<WH8163> as his brother<WH251> Esau's<WH6215> hands:<WH3027> so he blessed<WH1288> him.
And he said,<WH559> Art thou<WH859> my very<WH2088> son<WH1121> Esau?<WH6215> And he said,<WH559> I<WH589> am.

And he said,<WH559> Bring it near<WH5066> to me, and I will eat<WH398> of my son's<WH1121> venison,<WH4480> <WH6718> that<WH4616> my soul<WH5315> may bless<WH1288> thee. And he brought it near<WH5066> to him, and he did eat:<WH398> and he brought<WH935> him wine,<WH3196> and he drank.<WH8354>
And his father<WH1> Isaac<WH3327> said<WH559> unto<WH413> him, Come near<WH5066> now,<WH4994> and kiss<WH5401> me, my son.<WH1121>

And he came near,<WH5066> and kissed<WH5401> him: and he smelled<WH7306> <WH853> the smell<WH7381> of his raiment,<WH899> and blessed<WH1288> him, and said,<WH559> See,<WH7200> the smell<WH7381> of my son<WH1121> is as the smell<WH7381> of a field<WH7704> which<WH834> the LORD<WH3068> hath blessed: <WH1288>
Therefore God<WH430> give<WH5414> thee of the dew<WH4480> <WH2919> of heaven,<WH8064> and the fatness<WH4924> of the earth,<WH776> and plenty<WH7230> of corn<WH1715> and wine: <WH8492>

Let people<WH5971> serve<WH5647> thee, and nations<WH3816> bow down<WH7812> to thee: be<WH1933> lord<WH1376> over thy brethren,<WH251> and let thy mother's<WH517> sons<WH1121> bow down<WH7812> to thee: cursed<WH779> be every one that curseth<WH779> thee, and blessed<WH1288> be he that blesseth<WH1288> thee.

And it came to pass,<WH1961> as soon as<WH834> Isaac<WH3327> had made an end<WH3615> of blessing<WH1288> <WH853> Jacob,<WH3290> and Jacob<WH3290> was<WH1961> yet<WH389> scarce gone out<WH3318> <WH3318> from<WH4480> <WH854> the presence<WH6440> of Isaac<WH3327> his father,<WH1> that Esau<WH6215> his brother<WH251> came in<WH935> from his hunting.<WH4480> <WH6718>

And he<WH1931> also<WH1571> had made<WH6213> savory meat,<WH4303> and brought<WH935> it unto his father,<WH1> and said<WH559> unto his father,<WH1> Let my father<WH1> arise,<WH6965> and eat<WH398> of his son's<WH1121> venison,<WH4480> <WH6718> that<WH5668> thy soul<WH5315> may bless<WH1288> me.
And Isaac<WH3327> his father<WH1> said<WH559> unto him, Who<WH4310> art thou?<WH859> And he said,<WH559> I<WH589> am thy son,<WH1121> thy firstborn<WH1060> Esau.<WH6215>

And Isaac<WH3327> trembled<WH2729> very exceedingly,<WH2731> <WH1419> <WH5704> <WH3966> and said,<WH559> Who?<WH4310> where<WH645> is he<WH1931> that hath taken<WH6679> venison,<WH6718> and brought<WH935> it me, and I have eaten<WH398> of all<WH4480> <WH3605> before<WH2962> thou camest,<WH935> and have blessed<WH1288> him? yea,<WH1571> and he shall be<WH1961> blessed.<WH1288>

And when Esau<WH6215> heard<WH8085> <WH853> the words<WH1697> of his father,<WH1> he cried<WH6817> with a great<WH1419> and<WH5704> exceeding<WH3966> bitter<WH4751> cry,<WH6818> and said<WH559> unto his father,<WH1> Bless<WH1288> me, even me<WH589> also,<WH1571> O my father.<WH1>
And he said,<WH559> Thy brother<WH251> came<WH935> with subtlety,<WH4820> and hath taken away<WH3947> thy blessing.<WH1293>

And he said,<WH559> Is not he rightly<WH3588> named<WH7121> <WH8034> Jacob?<WH3290> for he hath supplanted<WH6117> me these<WH2088> two times:<WH6471> he took away<WH3947> <WH853> my birthright;<WH1062> and, behold,<WH2009> now<WH6258> he hath taken away<WH3947> my blessing.<WH1293> And he said,<WH559> Hast thou not<WH3808> reserved<WH680> a blessing<WH1293> for me?

And Isaac<WH3327> answered<WH6030> and said<WH559> unto Esau,<WH6215> Behold,<WH2005> I have made<WH7760> him thy lord,<WH1376> and all<WH3605> his brethren<WH251> have I given<WH5414> to him for servants;<WH5650> and with corn<WH1715> and wine<WH8492> have I sustained<WH5564> him: and what<WH4100> shall I do<WH6213> now<WH645> unto thee, my son?<WH1121>

And Esau<WH6215> said<WH559> unto<WH413> his father,<WH1> Hast thou but one<WH259> blessing,<WH1293> my father?<WH1> bless<WH1288> me, even me<WH589> also,<WH1571> O my father.<WH1> And Esau<WH6215> lifted up<WH5375> his voice,<WH6963> and wept.<WH1058>

And Isaac<WH3327> his father<WH1> answered<WH6030> and said<WH559> unto<WH413> him, Behold,<WH2009> thy dwelling<WH4186> shall be<WH1961> the fatness<WH4480> <WH4924> of the earth,<WH776> and of the dew<WH4480> <WH2919> of heaven<WH8064> from above;<WH4480> <WH5920>

And by<WH5921> thy sword<WH2719> shalt thou live,<WH2421> and shalt serve<WH5647> thy brother;<WH251> and it shall come to pass<WH1961> when<WH834> thou shalt have the dominion,<WH7300> that thou shalt break<WH6561> his yoke<WH5923> from off<WH4480> <WH5921> thy neck.<WH6677>

And Esau<WH6215> hated<WH7852> <WH853> Jacob<WH3290> because of<WH5921> the blessing<WH1293> wherewith<WH834> his father<WH1> blessed<WH1288> him: and Esau<WH6215> said<WH559> in his heart,<WH3820> The days<WH3117> of mourning<WH60> for my father<WH1> are at hand;<WH7126> then will I slay<WH2026> <WH853> my brother<WH251> Jacob.<WH3290>

And <WH853> these words<WH1697> of Esau<WH6215> her elder<WH1419> son<WH1121> were told<WH5046> to Rebekah:<WH7259> and she sent<WH7971> and called<WH7121> Jacob<WH3290> her younger<WH6996> son,<WH1121> and said<WH559> unto<WH413> him, Behold,<WH2009> thy brother<WH251> Esau,<WH6215> as touching thee, doth comfort himself,<WH5162> purposing to kill<WH2026> thee.
Now <WH6258> therefore, my son,<WH1121> obey<WH8085> my voice;<WH6963> and arise,<WH6965> flee<WH1272> thou to<WH413> Laban<WH3837> my brother<WH251> to Haran;<WH2771>
And tarry<WH3427> with<WH5973> him a few<WH259> days,<WH3117> until<WH5704> <WH834> thy brother's<WH251> fury<WH2534> turn away;<WH7725>

Until <WH5704> thy brother's<WH251> anger<WH639> turn away<WH7725> from<WH4480> thee, and he forget<WH7911> <WH853> that which<WH834> thou hast done<WH6213> to him: then I will send,<WH7971> and fetch<WH3947> thee from thence:<WH4480> <WH8033> why<WH4100> should I be deprived<WH7921> also<WH1571> of you both<WH8147> in one<WH259> day?<WH3117>

And Rebekah<WH7259> said<WH559> to<WH413> Isaac,<WH3327> I am weary<WH6973> of my life<WH2416> because<WH4480> <WH6440> of the daughters<WH1323> of Heth:<WH2845> if<WH518> Jacob<WH3290> take<WH3947> a wife<WH802> of the daughters<WH4480> <WH1323> of Heth,<WH2845> such as these<WH428> which are of the daughters<WH4480> <WH1323> of the land,<WH776> what good<WH4100> shall my life<WH2416> do me?
